name: Oyster Stew with Evaporated Milk
author: Robyn Dye
summary: This is a great stew for a cold and wintry night. It will warm you up inside.
ingredients: 50  baby carrots, cut in half lengthwise
4  russet potatoes, cut into bite-sized pieces
directions: Place the carrots, potatoes, onion, celery, and bouillon cubes in a stock pot; pour enough water over the vegetables to cover
Turn heat to medium-high and bring to a boil; allow to boil for 30 minutes
Add the oysters with their juices and 1 teaspoon black pepper; boil another 3 minutes; reduce heat to low
Stir in the evaporated milk and butter; cook and stir until the butter melts completely
Season with salt and pepper to serve
